scenarios.scenario_description: Gunshot wound to the chest with active bleeding

results.scenario: Gunshot wound to the chest with active bleeding
results.question: Is there any distention, contusion, penetration, evisceration or obvious bleeding observed?
results.user_answer: Initial query

results.scenario: Gunshot wound to the chest with active bleeding
results.question: Is an improvised occlusive chest seal applied over the open chest wound?
results.user_answer: Yes, there is active bleeding from the chest wound
checklist: Evaluate the casualty
Determine if bleeding is life-threatening
If bleeding is life-threatening, decide on the appropriate method for massive hemorrhage control
citations: Ch6 §6-2 | METHODS FOR CONTROLLING EXTERNAL BLEEDING | p.35–35

results.scenario: Gunshot wound to the chest with active bleeding
results.question: Is the casualty breathing normally? (Observable signs: chest rising and falling, airflow, respiration rate)
results.user_answer: No, the airway is clear and patient is breathing
checklist: Check for breathing
Monitor the casualty's respirations
Maintain an open airway

results.scenario: Gunshot wound to the chest with active bleeding
results.question: Is the casualty's carotid pulse detectable within 10 seconds?
results.user_answer: Yes, breathing is labored and shallow
checklist: Assess breathing and ventilation
Open the airway using jaw thrust method
Check for normal or abnormal breathing

results.scenario: Gunshot wound to the chest with active bleeding
results.question: Is the casualty being kept warm and insulated?
results.user_answer: Weak pulse, skin is pale and cool
checklist: Check the casualty's pulse
Assess skin color and temperature

results.scenario: Gunshot wound to the chest with active bleeding
results.question: Does the casualty report any persistent or worsening pain after controlling active bleeding from the gunshot wound?
results.user_answer: No signs of hypothermia, no head injury
checklist: Check the casualty for signs of hypothermia (numbness, tingling, pale/yellowish skin, frozen tissue, etc.)
Assess the casualty for head injury or altered consciousness.

results.scenario: Gunshot wound to the chest with active bleeding
results.question: Is there active bleeding or any signs of penetrating wound? If yes, is the casualty aware of any known allergies to antibiotics?
results.user_answer: Patient reports severe pain (8/10)
checklist: Assess pain level of the patient
Determine if analgesia is required based on pain assessment

results.scenario: Gunshot wound to the chest with active bleeding
results.question: Is there any evidence of new or missed wounds on the casualty?
results.user_answer: Yes, penetrating wound requires antibiotics, no known allergies
checklist: Check for the presence of penetrating wound
Determine if there is active bleeding
Note any known allergies to antibiotics

results.scenario: Gunshot wound to the chest with active bleeding
results.question: Is there any deformity, tenderness, swelling, pain, inability to move the injured part, protruding bone, or discolored skin at the injury site?
results.user_answer: Chest wound is bleeding, no other injuries visible
checklist: Check for other injuries
Verify all dressings and seals
Inspect the wound for distention, contusions, penetration, eviscerations or obvious bleeding

results.scenario: Gunshot wound to the chest with active bleeding
results.question: Is there active bleeding or any signs of shock?
results.user_answer: No fractures detected, patient can move all limbs
checklist: [Ch13 §13-6 | APPLY A RIGID SPLINT | p.63–63]
[Ch13 §13-9 | LOWER EXTREMITY FRACTURES | p.64–64]
[Ch13 §13-7 | Apply A Rigid Splint | p.63–63]

scenarios.scenario_description: Severe burns to the right arm

results.scenario: Severe burns to the right arm
results.question: Is there any active bleeding or large gaping wounds requiring tourniquet, packing, or direct pressure for control?
results.user_answer: Initial query

results.scenario: Severe burns to the right arm
results.question: Is the casualty breathing normally?
results.user_answer: No active bleeding, but severe burns present
checklist: Inspect for any life-threatening bleeding
Evaluate if direct pressure or tourniquet is required

results.scenario: Severe burns to the right arm
results.question: Is the casualty able to breathe normally? If not, what is the respiratory rate for 15 seconds?
results.user_answer: Airway is clear, patient is breathing normally
checklist: Check the airway for obstruction
Confirm if patient is breathing normally

results.scenario: Severe burns to the right arm
results.question: Is there a carotid pulse present and what is the casualty's skin color and temperature?
results.user_answer: Breathing is normal, no respiratory distress
checklist: Check for normal breathing
Monitor for any signs of respiratory distress

results.scenario: Severe burns to the right arm
results.question: Is the casualty's skin or clothing wet? (Ch12 §None [p.57–58])
results.user_answer: Strong pulse, good circulation to unaffected areas
checklist: Check the casualty for signs and symptoms of shock (Ch8 §8-1, p.41–41)
Assess if the bleeding from the burn is life-threatening (Ch6 §6-1, p.35–35)
If necessary, control the external bleeding using direct pressure or a pressure dressing (Ch6 §6-4, Ch6 §6-6)

results.scenario: Severe burns to the right arm
results.question: Is the casualty experiencing significant pain due to the burns?
results.user_answer: No hypothermia, no head injury
checklist: Check the casualty's temperature
Assess for any signs of head injury

results.scenario: Severe burns to the right arm
results.question: Is there any evidence of burns on the casualty? (If yes, proceed with treatment as per Chapter 7, Task 081COM-1007.) Has the casualty reported any allergies to antibiotics?
results.user_answer: Severe pain from burns (9/10)
checklist: Assess the pain level using a recognized scale (e.g., Visual Analog Scale). - [Ch2 §2-1 | Evaluate A Casualty (081-COM-1001) | p.21–21]
Determine if there are any signs and symptoms of shock such as sweating, paleness, restlessness, or rapid breathing. - [Ch8 §8-1 | SIGNS AND SYMPTOMS OF SHOCK | p.41–41]
citations: [Ch8 §8-1 | SIGNS AND SYMPTOMS OF SHOCK | p.41–41]

results.scenario: Severe burns to the right arm
results.question: Is there any evidence of wounds on the casualty?
results.user_answer: Yes, burns require antibiotics, no allergies
checklist: Check for penetrating wounds
Identify any allergies to antibiotics

results.scenario: Severe burns to the right arm
results.question: Is the suspected fracture immobilized and distal pulse checked after splinting?
results.user_answer: Severe burns on right arm, no other injuries
checklist: Inspect the casualty for missed injuries or eviscerations.
Verify all dressings and seals.

results.scenario: Severe burns to the right arm
results.question: Is there any sign of burns on the casualty's right arm?
results.user_answer: No fractures, but burns may affect mobility
checklist: Prepare a rigid splint.
Immobilize the right arm in the position of function.
Re-check distal pulse after splinting.

scenarios.scenario_description: Blunt force trauma to the head with altered consciousness

results.scenario: Blunt force trauma to the head with altered consciousness
results.question: Is there active bleeding that requires control?
results.user_answer: Initial query

results.scenario: Blunt force trauma to the head with altered consciousness
results.question: Is the airway clear or obstructed?
results.user_answer: No external bleeding visible
checklist: Evaluate the casualty for life-threatening conditions
Check for visible external bleeding

results.scenario: Blunt force trauma to the head with altered consciousness
results.question: Is the casualty breathing adequately?
results.user_answer: Airway is clear but patient is unconscious
checklist: Check the airway for obstruction.
Perform jaw thrust maneuver if no suspected spinal injury.
Count the number of respirations for 15 seconds.

results.scenario: Blunt force trauma to the head with altered consciousness
results.question: Is there a carotid pulse present and is the casualty breathing normally?
results.user_answer: Breathing is irregular and shallow
checklist: Open the airway using the jaw thrust method (if there is suspected spinal injury) - Ch3 §3-4
Assess the casualty for a response and look for normal or abnormal breathing - Ch15 §15-2

results.scenario: Blunt force trauma to the head with altered consciousness
results.question: Is the casualty experiencing decreased alertness or confusion?
results.user_answer: Weak and irregular pulse
checklist: Assess the casualty's pulse quality (Ch15 §15-2)
Check for signs of shock (Ch8 §8-1)
Decide if fluids or blood products are required based on pulse quality and shock signs

results.scenario: Blunt force trauma to the head with altered consciousness
results.question: Is the casualty experiencing any signs of pain or discomfort? (Focus on eye injuries and level of consciousness)
results.user_answer: Patient is unconscious, possible head injury
checklist: Assess the patient's temperature
Check for signs of hypothermia (numbness, pale skin, tingling)
Monitor for heat stroke symptoms (hot dry skin, headache)
Loosen constricting clothing
Move the patient to a sheltered area if possible

results.scenario: Blunt force trauma to the head with altered consciousness
results.question: Is there any evidence of eye injury or the casualty wearing contact lenses?
results.user_answer: Patient is unconscious, cannot assess pain
checklist: Assess the level of consciousness using AVPU method (Ch7 §7-1, p.22–22)

results.scenario: Blunt force trauma to the head with altered consciousness
results.question: Is there any evidence of wounds on the casualty?
results.user_answer: No penetrating wounds, no antibiotics needed
checklist: Assess the casualty's level of consciousness (AVPU) using Ch7 §7-1
Check for penetrating wounds or abdominal injuries according to Ch17 §17-1 and Ch24 §24-5

results.scenario: Blunt force trauma to the head with altered consciousness
results.question: Is there any evidence of altered pulse after immobilizing and splinting the suspected fracture?
results.user_answer: Head injury visible, no other external injuries
checklist: Inspect the wound for missed injuries
Verify all dressings and seals

results.scenario: Blunt force trauma to the head with altered consciousness
results.question: Is the casualty conscious or unconscious? (Check for signs of fractures and assess life-threatening conditions.)
results.user_answer: No fractures detected
checklist: [Ch13 §13-7 | Apply A Rigid Splint]
[Ch13 §13-16 | Prepare Cravats]

scenarios.scenario_description: Open fracture of the left femur with bleeding

results.scenario: Open fracture of the left femur with bleeding
results.question: Is there life-threatening bleeding requiring either direct pressure or a tourniquet?
results.user_answer: Initial query

results.scenario: Open fracture of the left femur with bleeding
results.question: Is the airway clear and patient breathing normally?
results.user_answer: Yes, there is bleeding from the open fracture
checklist: Check for life-threatening bleeding
Apply direct pressure if bleeding is not life-threatening

results.scenario: Open fracture of the left femur with bleeding
results.question: Is the casualty's respiration rate less than 2 per 15 seconds or is the casualty unconscious?
results.user_answer: Airway is clear, patient is conscious and breathing
checklist: Check for breathing as per [Ch3 §3-5, p.26–26]
Confirm airway is clear and open as per [Ch3 §3-8, p.27–27]

results.scenario: Open fracture of the left femur with bleeding
results.question: Is there a detectable pulse? (Assesses perfusion)
results.user_answer: Breathing is normal
checklist: Check for breathing
Open the airway using the jaw thrust method (if suspected spinal injury) or headtilt chinlift method (if no suspected spinal injury)

results.scenario: Open fracture of the left femur with bleeding
results.question: Is the casualty showing signs of shivering or apathy?
results.user_answer: Weak pulse due to blood loss
checklist: Check the casualty's pulse
Assess skin color and temperature
Decide if fluids or blood products are required

results.scenario: Open fracture of the left femur with bleeding
results.question: Is there any observed deformity, tenderness, swelling, pain, inability to move the injured part, protruding bone, discolored skin at the injury site, or bleeding that may indicate a fracture?
results.user_answer: No hypothermia, no head injury
checklist: Check the casualty for signs of hypothermia.
Assess if the casualty's skin or clothing is wet.

results.scenario: Open fracture of the left femur with bleeding
results.question: Does the casualty present with signs and symptoms of a fracture? Is there any known allergy to antibiotics?
results.user_answer: Severe pain from fracture (10/10)
checklist: Assess pain level
Check for presence of severe pain (10/10)

results.scenario: Open fracture of the left femur with bleeding
results.question: Is there evidence of deformity, tenderness, swelling, pain, inability to move the injured part, protruding bone, bleeding, discolored skin at the injury site on any part of the casualty's body?
results.user_answer: Yes, open fracture requires antibiotics, no allergies
checklist: Check for the need of a rigid splint (Ch13 §13-6, p.63–63)
Check if there are any allergies to antibiotics (not specified)

results.scenario: Open fracture of the left femur with bleeding
results.question: Is the left femur immobilized using a splint and distal pulse checked after splinting?
results.user_answer: Open fracture of left femur, no other injuries
checklist: Check for any signs of additional injuries
Inspect the dressing and seals on the open fracture of the left femur
Verify that a rigid splint has been applied to immobilize the fractured limb

results.scenario: Open fracture of the left femur with bleeding
results.question: Is the fractured extremity properly splinted and immobilized?
results.user_answer: Obvious fracture of left femur, needs splinting
checklist: Apply padding
Secure a splint to the injured extremity with the limb in the position of function
Recheck the distal pulse

scenarios.scenario_description: Penetrating abdominal wound with organ evisceration

results.scenario: Penetrating abdominal wound with organ evisceration
results.question: Is there distention, contusion, penetration, evisceration or obvious bleeding at the abdominal wound?
results.user_answer: Initial query

results.scenario: Penetrating abdominal wound with organ evisceration
results.question: Is the casualty's airway clear or obstructed?
results.user_answer: No external bleeding, but internal bleeding suspected
checklist: Check for obvious bleeding
Expose the wound
Inspect for distention, contusions, penetration, eviscerations or obvious bleeding
Apply direct pressure

results.scenario: Penetrating abdominal wound with organ evisceration
results.question: Is the casualty breathing normally? (Check for signs of breathing - listen, observe chest rise and fall, feel air escaping.)
results.user_answer: Airway is clear, patient is conscious
checklist: Check if the airway is clear
Monitor the patient's breathing

results.scenario: Penetrating abdominal wound with organ evisceration
results.question: Is the casualty's pulse quality normal? (If not, is fluid or blood product administration required?)
results.user_answer: Breathing is shallow due to pain
checklist: Check the casualty's breathing
Look for chest to rise and fall
Listen for air escaping during exhalation
Feel for the flow of air on the side of your face

results.scenario: Penetrating abdominal wound with organ evisceration
results.question: Is the casualty exhibiting signs of hypothermia?
results.user_answer: Rapid weak pulse, signs of shock
checklist: Check for rapid weak pulse.
Assess signs of shock.

results.scenario: Penetrating abdominal wound with organ evisceration
results.question: Is there any evidence of pain or discomfort in the casualty?
results.user_answer: No hypothermia, no head injury
checklist: Check for signs of hypothermia (numbness, pale or yellowish skin, etc.)
Maintain casualty's body heat with insulation and/or warm fluids, if available.

results.scenario: Penetrating abdominal wound with organ evisceration
results.question: Does the casualty have any known allergies to antibiotics and does the penetrating abdominal wound require antibiotic treatment?
results.user_answer: Severe abdominal pain (9/10)
checklist: Assess the pain level
Inspect for distention, contusions, penetration, eviscerations or obvious bleeding.
Expose the wound.

results.scenario: Penetrating abdominal wound with organ evisceration
results.question: Is there any distention, penetration, evisceration, or obvious bleeding observed at the wound site?
results.user_answer: Yes, penetrating wound requires antibiotics, no allergies
checklist: Check for internal organ damage and large blood vessel injuries
Determine the presence of any allergies to antibiotics

results.scenario: Penetrating abdominal wound with organ evisceration
results.question: Is there any distention, penetration, eviscerations or obvious bleeding observed?
results.user_answer: Abdominal evisceration visible, no other injuries
checklist: Inspect for distention, contusions, penetration, eviscerations or obvious bleeding.
Verify the presence of an abdominal wound.

results.scenario: Penetrating abdominal wound with organ evisceration
results.question: Is there any evidence of internal organ evisceration or active bleeding?
results.user_answer: No fractures detected
checklist: Check the distal pulse after immobilizing the suspected fracture.
Apply a rigid splint to the suspected fractured limb.

results.scenario: Minor laceration to the hand
results.question: Is there active bleeding?
results.user_answer: Initial query

results.scenario: Minor laceration to the hand
results.question: Is the casualty experiencing a severe airway obstruction? [Ch4 §None | p.29–30]
results.user_answer: No, only minor bleeding from small cut
checklist: Is there active bleeding?
If no, is the wound gaping or large?

results.scenario: Minor laceration to the hand
results.question: Is the casualty breathing normally and is it possible to count the number of respirations for 15 seconds?
results.user_answer: Airway is clear, breathing normally
checklist: Open the airway using the jaw thrust maneuver
Check for breathing as described in Ch3 §3-5

results.scenario: Minor laceration to the hand
results.question: Does the casualty have a carotid pulse?
results.user_answer: Breathing is normal
checklist: Check the casualty's breathing rate.
Look for any signs of respiratory distress.

results.scenario: Minor laceration to the hand
results.question: Is the casualty experiencing signs of hypothermia?
results.user_answer: Strong pulse, good circulation
checklist: Check pulse quality
Assess skin color/temperature

results.scenario: Minor laceration to the hand
results.question: Does the casualty exhibit any signs of frostbite and if so, what is their reported pain level?
results.user_answer: No hypothermia, no head injury
checklist: Check for signs of hypothermia such as shivering, cold skin, and slurred speech.

results.scenario: Minor laceration to the hand
results.question: Is there an active infection or allergy to antibiotics in the hand laceration?
results.user_answer: Mild pain (3/10)
checklist: Evaluate the pain level
Assess for any signs of nerve agent poisoning
citations: Ch9 §9-1 | FIRST AID FOR NERVE AGENT INJURY [p.43–43]

results.scenario: Minor laceration to the hand
results.question: Is the dressing on the hand wound still intact and in place? Are there any signs of missed injuries, burns or eviscerations around the wound?
results.user_answer: No, minor injury doesn't require antibiotics
checklist: Check for signs of penetrating wound, such as foreign bodies or protruding (impaled) objects.

results.scenario: Minor laceration to the hand
results.question: Is there any evidence of a fracture in the hand?
results.user_answer: Small cut on hand, no other injuries
checklist: Inspect the wound for missed injuries
Verify all dressings and seals

results.scenario: Minor laceration to the hand
results.question: Is there deformity, tenderness, swelling, pain, or inability to move the injured hand?
results.user_answer: No fractures detected
checklist: Check for any signs of fractures.
Immobilize the suspected fractured area using a rigid splint.

Is there a carotid pulse present and what is the casualty's skin color and temperature?
Is there a carotid pulse present and is the casualty breathing normally?
Is the casualty being kept warm and insulated?

Is the casualty experiencing decreased alertness or confusion?
Does the casualty report any persistent or worsening pain after controlling active bleeding from the gunshot wound?
Is the casualty experiencing significant pain due to the burns?
Is the casualty experiencing any signs of pain or discomfort? (Focus on eye injuries and level of consciousness)
Is there active bleeding or any signs of penetrating wound? If yes, is the casualty aware of any known allergies to antibiotics?
Is there any evidence of burns on the casualty? (If yes, proceed with treatment as per Chapter 7, Task 081COM-1007.) Has the casualty reported any allergies to antibiotics?
Is there any evidence of eye injury or the casualty wearing contact lenses?
Is there any evidence of new or missed wounds on the casualty?
Is there any evidence of wounds on the casualty?
Is there any evidence of wounds on the casualty?

Is the suspected fracture immobilized and distal pulse checked after splinting?
Is there any evidence of altered pulse after immobilizing and splinting the suspected fracture?
